summary: I am a perfectionist, hardworking and loyal person. My aim is always to strive for the best results with high quality, no matter what job I am working on. I am dynamic, function best in a divers team, and assume in a natural way the role of manager or leader. My focus lies in fulfilling the job as best as I can together with my colleagues, and to serve the objectives of the company.

awards.title: WFP Innovation Accelerator Awards
awards.description: While working with ICCO Cooperation together with the team and with WFP we designed a pop-up retail shops in emergencies project in Cox's Bazar. The project was one of the five winners of the 2019 WFP Innovation Awards, these innovative solutions exemplify how WFP is embracing innovation and technology to achieve Zero Hunger.

awards.title: United Nations Student Prize 2018
awards.description: The United Nations Student Association, Oslo, awarded Refugee 4 Refugees the “United Nations Student Prize 2018” for our dedicated efforts in protecting and promoting the human rights of refugees, which is in accordance with the United Nations’ Universal Declaration of Human Rights and the Sustainable Development Goals.

courses.name: Off road and emergency driving training (Frontex, European Border Force)

profile_positions.description:
•	Co-founder and active board member of R4R, a grassroots NGO that in 2018 was the Winner of the United Nations Student Prize for our dedicated efforts in protecting and promoting the human rights of refugees, in accordance with the United Nations’ Universal Declaration of Human Rights and the Sustainable Development Goals.
•	Provide services to migrants seeking asylum on the Greek islands of Lesvos/Samos/Kos in the thematic areas of food security, NFI distribution, health, and protection of unaccompanied minors. Work in direct partnership with the Greek Government, and the Greek army as an implementing partner for services in the camps. 
•	Led the establishment of a rapid response operation in Romania to provide basic needs services to refugees arriving from Ukraine. This included shelter, food, NFIs assistance, and protection assistance.
•	Design organisational structures, and develop financial systems, and HR policies that adapt quickly for this rapidly growing NGO of 15 staff and 50 fulltime volunteers (community and international). Actively train staff and mentor the management team to strengthen their capacity to deliver organizational goals.
•	Support the programme team in setting strategic direction, and designing projects in accordance to SPHERE standards. 
•	Ensure compliance across the organisation to relevant policies and procedures. Train staff in the these and monitor where adaptations are needed and non-compliance has occurred.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder / Board of Directors

profile_positions.description:
•	Programme manager for a portfolio of 24 projects across 15 countries valued at € 20m.
•	Liaison point for key institutional donors, including the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs and IKEA Foundation.
•	Overall responsible for donor reporting, including narrative and financial reporting, compliance, and reporting against indicators set out in results frameworks. 
•	Successfully coordinated the setup of the first phase of the 2021 programme. This includes working with partners to negotiate project proposal and budget content so that all contracts were aligned to internal regulations and signed on time.
•	Provided regular technical, financial and monitoring support to project team members across 15 countries, including project managers, technical experts and Country Directors. Where necessary acted as a liaison to the donor so that the country office teams could respond to the needs on the ground.
•	Developed a clear programme overview and monitoring system that efficiently captured the progress of activities (financial, results against targets, administrative status of each project).
•	Ensured up to date documentation of all information in the internal system (SPACE), as per programme requirements and internal compliance regulations.
profile_positions.title: Programme Manager - Response Preparedness

profile_positions.description:
•	Programme Manager responsible for designing and realising ICCO’s Bangladesh Rohingya Refugee Response (25 staff members)
•	Overall responsible for the planning, implementation, monitoring, evaluation, and reporting on project portfolio of 2.5 million Euro.
•	
•	Technical expert in design and implementation of Food Security and Resilient Livelihoods programming that mainstream gender and protection. Results include designing a project awarded with the United Nations World Food Programme Innovation Accelerator (a global competition). 
•	Successfully built donor relationships on evidence-based project results. Doubled funding of programme portfolio to 2.5 million Euro. Brought onboard new donors including WFP, and GIZ. Strengthened relationships and increased funding from existing donors such as IOM and GAC. Acted as a key contributor to project proposal writing.
•	Strengthened monitoring and evaluation tools through revising reporting formats and training teams on the development and use of log frames so that activity results were measured in terms of expected outcomes/outputs.
•	Responsible for financial and narrative reporting.
•	Primary contact point for ICCO Cooperation for the local government, UN Agencies, and in Cluster Coordination meetings. Acted as a technical advisor to the Livelihoods Working Group.
•	Set the staffing structure for ICCO’s Emergency Response team. Strengthened staff capacity through appraisal, objective setting, coaching, and training. Strong at closely monitoring staff performance to foster the wellbeing of the team by creating space for equality, cooperation and team work, promoting a positive and transparent working environment in line with organisational values.
•	Partner management; select, support, and monitor progress of implementing partner NGOs.
profile_positions.title: Programme Manager Emergency Response

profile_positions.description:
•	Overall emergency coordinator in the field. Assisting the needs of asylum seekers, coordinating the first response aid, providing relief to Persons of Concern during boat landings on the shore.
•	Primary contact and coordinator with local authorities, local community, and organisations actively working in the area. (UNHCR, Hellenic Coast Guard, Port Police, Frontex Police, MSF, Safe the Children, Proactiva).
•	Provided operational support on the field to UNHCR, identifying protection needs (age, gender and diversity).
•	In charge of coordinating and leading a team of +/-30 volunteers for emergency response, and two transitional refugee camps (Lighthouse Relief, and UNHCR Camp), involving food and NFI distribution.
•	Implementing new programs and guidelines in order to fulfil the objectives of the organisation.
•	Monitoring and reporting weekly activities and possible changes.
•	Responsible for HR, administration, monthly budgets, writing reports, fundraising proposals, schedules, logistic, and inventory.
•	Developed contingency plans, and keep up to date SOPs, and communications plans for internal and external actors.
•	Worked in a multicultural environment, coordinating different internal areas, ensuring the accomplishment of daily activities by volunteers.
•	Responsible for briefing, and training staff members and volunteers, to ensure the familiarity with working methodology in emergencies, policies and guidelines.
•	Responsible for communicating with other actors, and faithfully representing the organisation in the media.
•	Attended regular trainings for non-medical volunteers on first aid, and CPR, and trainings on triage during emergencies in order to assist medical organisations in crisis situations.
profile_positions.title: Emergency Response Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
•	Produced five documentaries, and several promotional short videos, including direction, camera shooting and editing.
•	Developed photography portfolios for different Latin American and Dutch projects.
•	Developed communications strategies, working with traditional and social media.
•	Wrote projects, drafted budgets and fundraised for partner organisations in Latin America.
•	As a Head of Production: Set up a local team, giving training and overseeing the working development. Arranging visas, travel procedure, and accommodation for the international team in the field. 
•	As a Project Leader: Collaborated with team leadership, gave workshops and capacity building to artists during theatre productions, worked with budgets, worked in the field for projects in Bolivia, Honduras, Guatemala, Peru, Ecuador, and the Netherlands.
•	Proven ability to work in different languages, and as a translator, both writing and speaking.
•	Build stages, audio, and light for theatre performances.
•	Wide working experience with Final Cut Pro/X, StopMotion, Compressor, and Photoshop software, and managing cameras HDV/MiniDV, HDSLR and GoPro.
profile_positions.title: Documentary Maker, Photographer and Production Leader

profile_positions.description:
•	Successfully led, coached, and built a team of 70 people, planning monthly schedules, and dealing with daily changes.
•	Capacity to work individually and within a team.
•	Strategically thinking in order to fulfil objectives, and reach targets and goals.
•	Ability to meet customers’ needs in different kind of environments (+/-1000 clients per day).
•	Worked with administrative, and office management tasks.
•	Direct responsible of the preparatory department, in charge of tasks such as: HR management, developing new training strategies, and giving capacity training to new staff.
•	Controlling quality in order to fulfil the national hygiene rules, and ensure the quality and freshness of products (HACCP).
•	In charge of logistics, inventory, managing orders and daily product deliveries.
profile_positions.title: Floor Manager

profile_positions.description:
·	Founder, and Country Director of the organization.
·	Emergency Response coordinator in the field; building houses in affected areas after an earthquake.
·	As members of a Latin American network, responsible for maintaining relationships, and communications with other organizations in Latin America.
·	Wrote and revised project proposals, writing budgets and carrying out fundraising.
·	In charged of administration and budgets.
·	Gave lectures to students in different universities, in order to create social awareness and recruit volunteers for different projects.
·	Successfully managed and coordinated teams of +/- 100 young volunteers from universities in different cities in Peru.
·	Developed training for working methodology, and created team-building programs for the staff members and volunteers.
·	Developed programmes to involve benefited families in a common collaboration with volunteers.
·	In charge of logistics, and quality control of building process.
profile_positions.title: Founder and Country Director

volunteer_experiences.description:
•	Primary support to management in coordinating the assistance for asylum seekers, giving first basic aid during landings on the shore.
•	Assisted the coordination of +/-30 volunteers in a transitional refugee camp.
•	Responsible of giving trainings to volunteers.
